page.title: 09ENTERTAINMENT MUSIC POP
page.content: In a class survey at Rotheram High 'pop' music came out on top to the almost entire exclusion of other music forms. The most popular were groups Wham, Duran Duran, Sister Sledge, and the Five Star. Michael Jackson, Paul Hardcastle with Vietnam 19 were also mentionned more than twice. Reggae style music was included by one, but a larger number were keen on music for bod popping and break dancing. The reasons for choice were the good beat and sounds, one person expressed the view that a solo artiste didn't provide enough music, they liked 4 or 5 in a group. Some liked slow and fast music. The Bucks Fizz group's win at the 1981 European Song Contest was also noted. One who liked Duran Duran thought they had good singers and instruments. He thought they were rich and could do lots of concerts , discs.
